Adult male.description: Males have a large white patch in the wing (often concealed) that Surf Scoters lack. They also have a smaller bill than Surf Scoters and lack the white head patch.

Female.description: Females have an oval white patch between the bill and eye as opposed to the vertical patch on the side of the head on female Surf Scoters. They also have a large white patch in wings (often concealed).

Adult male.description: Male Black Scoters have a yellow knob on their bill that Surf Scoters lack. Their body is entirely black unlike Surf Scoters.

Female.description: Female Black Scoters have a darker cap and a larger white cheek patch than female Surf Scoters.

Adult.description: American Coots are smaller than Surf Scoters with a smaller and thinner bill. They also lack the Surf Scoters white patch on the back of the neck.
